meanings.definition: The process of making someone or something overly sensitive or reactive.
meanings.sent1: The hypersensitization of his skin made him jump at the slightest touch.
meanings.sent2: Her hypersensitization to loud noises made it difficult for her to concentrate.
meanings.sent3: The hypersensitization of the alarm clock led to her waking up at the sound of a pin drop.
meanings.sent4: His hypersensitization to criticism turned him into an emotional sponge, absorbing every negative comment.
meanings.sent5: The hypersensitization of the dog to the doorbell made it bark uncontrollably at any sound.

meanings.definition: The act of becoming excessively sensitive to a particular stimulus.
meanings.sent1: After the accident, his hypersensitization to bright lights caused him constant discomfort.
meanings.sent2: The gradual hypersensitization to pollen made her allergies worse each year.
meanings.sent3: The hypersensitization to spicy food turned him into the 'chili challenge champion' at the office.
meanings.sent4: Her hypersensitization to the sound of laughter made her feel like she was always the butt of the joke.
meanings.sent5: The hypersensitization to the smell of coffee made her crave a cup every time she passed a cafe.
